page.title: 15HIGH LEYS FARM:NORTH/ELTON
page.content: A 300 acre farm of mixed arable land. The family consisted of farmer, wife and two young children living in modern detached house, owner occupied. The farmer had lived there for 31 years, was born in area, as were his parents. Casual labour was employed at harvest and when required. He owned two cars, shopped in Stamford and Peterborough and children taken by car to school in Oundle. Main leisure pursuits were television and reading. They took a daily newspaper. They enjoyed living there because it combined country living with easy access to good amenities. The only disadvantage was the close proximity of Sibson Airfield which they found disturbing, particularly at week-ends.
